questions.text: A 35-year-old woman is scheduled for an elective laparoscopic cholecystectomy as a day care surgery. She is otherwise healthy with no significant medical history. Which of the following intravenous anesthetic agents would be the ideal choice for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Propofol

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . Ketamine - While ketamine is a potent anesthetic and analgesic agent , it can lead to a significant increase in heart rate and blood pressure , and potentially hallucinations upon emergence. It's not typically the first choice for day care surgeries.
  • • Option A
  • • potent anesthetic
  • • analgesic agent
  • • significant increase in heart rate
  • • blood pressure
  • • potentially hallucinations
  • • Option B . Thiopental - Thiopental is a barbiturate that can provide rapid induction , but it has a longer duration of action and recovery time compared to other agents. It is also associated with a high incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV) , which is not ideal for day care surgery.
  • • Option B
  • • barbiturate
  • • provide rapid induction
  • • longer duration of action
  • • recovery time
  • • postoperative nausea and vomiting (PONV)
  • • Option C . Etomidate - Etomidate provides rapid induction and has a short duration of action . However, it lacks analgesic properties and can cause adrenal suppression , making it less desirable for this scenario.
  • • Option C
  • • rapid induction
  • • short duration of action
  • • lacks analgesic properties
  • • adrenal suppression

  • • Day care anesthesia , also known as ambulatory anesthesia or outpatient anesthesia , refers to the administration of anesthesia for surgical or medical procedures that are performed on an outpatient basis, typically in a healthcare facility such as a hospital, surgical center, or clinic. In day care anesthesia, patients undergo anesthesia for their procedure and are discharged on the same day once they have recovered from the effects of anesthesia and the procedure itself. This approach allows patients to return home or to a non-hospital setting shortly after their surgery or intervention, without the need for an overnight hospital stay . Day care anesthesia is commonly used for a wide range of elective and minimally invasive procedures , and it aims to provide effective anesthesia while minimizing the patient's length of stay in the healthcare facility.

questions.text: Which of the following patients would NOT be typically considered as an ideal candidate for day care surgery?

options.label: A
options.text: A healthy 30-year-old man needing an inguinal hernia repair

options.label: B
options.text: A 45-year-old woman with well-controlled diabetes requiring a laparoscopic cholecystectomy

options.label: C
options.text: An elderly woman needing a cataract operation who lives with a mentally challenged caretaker

options.label: D
options.text: A 25-year-old woman requiring diagnostic laparoscopy for endometriosis

questions.correct_answer: C. An elderly woman needing a cataract operation who lives with a mentally challenged caretaker
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. An elderly woman needing a cataract operation who lives with a mentally challenged caretaker

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . A healthy 30-year-old man needing an inguinal hernia repair - This patient would be an ideal candidate for day care surgery as he is young, healthy, and the procedure he needs is commonly performed as an outpatient procedure.
  • • Option A
  • • inguinal hernia repair
  • • ideal candidate for day care surgery
  • • Option B . A 45-year-old woman with well-controlled diabetes requiring a laparoscopic cholecystectomy - While she has diabetes, it is well-controlled, and she is otherwise healthy. The procedure she requires is often performed on an outpatient basis, making her a suitable candidate for day care surgery.
  • • Option B
  • • Option D . A 25-year-old woman requiring diagnostic laparoscopy for endometriosis - This is a common outpatient procedure and she is young and presumably healthy, making her a good candidate for day care surgery.
  • • Option D
  • • diagnostic laparoscopy

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ Ideal candidates for day care surgery , also known as outpatient surgery , are typically individuals who are in good general health , have stable medical conditions , and meet specific criteria . These candidates should be mentally and emotionally stable , have a responsible adult to accompany them home, and follow preoperative instructions . They should undergo relatively straightforward and low-risk elective procedures , with realistic expectations about surgery and recovery. Individualized assessments by the surgical team, including the surgeon and anesthesiologist, prioritize patient safety and minimize risks.

questions.text: A 40-year-old man is scheduled for a day care knee arthroscopy. Which of the following inhalational anesthetics would be the best choice for this patient?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Sevoflurane

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . Isoflurane - While isoflurane is a commonly used inhalational anesthetic , it has a slower onset and offset compared to other agents, and it can cause a greater degree of cardiovascular depression , making it less ideal for day care surgeries.
  • • Option A
  • • commonly used inhalational anesthetic
  • • slower onset and offset
  • • greater degree of cardiovascular depression
  • • Option B . Desflurane - Desflurane has a very rapid onset and offset , but it can cause airway irritation and coughing , especially upon induction, which is not ideal in the outpatient setting.
  • • Option B
  • • very rapid onset and offset
  • • airway irritation and coughing
  • • Option C . Halothane - Halothane is an older agent not commonly used today due to its side effects , including the potential for hepatotoxicity and cardiac arrhythmias .
  • • Option C
  • • older agent
  • • side effects
  • • hepatotoxicity
  • • cardiac arrhythmias

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective
  • ➤ :
  • ➤ Sevoflurane is the appropriate choice of inhalational anesthetic , for day care surgery, considering factors such as rapid onset and recovery , minimal airway irritation , and suitability for outpatient procedures .
  • ➤ Sevoflurane
  • ➤ inhalational anesthetic
  • ➤ rapid onset
  • ➤ recovery
  • ➤ minimal airway irritation
  • ➤ suitability
  • ➤ outpatient procedures

questions.text: A 50-year-old man has undergone a day care laparoscopic hernia repair. What scoring system is typically used to assess when a patient is ready for discharge from the post-anesthesia care unit (PACU) following day care surgery?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D) Aldrete score

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . APGAR score - This is a quick scoring system used to assess the physical status of a newborn immediately after birth . It's not relevant for assessing recovery from anesthesia in adults.
  • • Option A
  • • quick scoring system
  • • assess the physical status
  • • newborn immediately after birth
  • • Option B . ASA physical status classification - This is used to assess a patient's overall health status prior to anesthesia , but it's not used for assessing recovery from anesthesia.
  • • Option B
  • • patient's overall health
  • • prior to anesthesia
  • • Option C . Mallampati score - This is used to predict the ease of intubation , but it's not used for assessing recovery from anesthesia.
  • • Option C
  • • predict the ease of intubation

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ The Aldrete score is a common scoring system employed to assess a patient's readiness for discharge from the Post-Anesthesia Care Unit (PACU) after day care surgery, considering parameters such as consciousness , oxygen saturation , hemodynamic stability , respiratory status , and ability to move .

questions.text: Which opioid is commonly preferred as the opioid of choice for day care anesthesia due to its rapid onset, short duration of action, and titratability?
questions.explanation:
Ans. C. Remifentanil

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . Morphine - Morphine is a potent opioid analgesic , but it has a relatively long duration of action and slower onset , making it less suitable for day care anesthesia. It also causes respiratory depression easily.
  • • Option A
  • • potent opioid analgesic
  • • relatively long duration of action and slower onset
  • • respiratory depression easily.
  • • Option B . Fentanyl - Fentanyl is a commonly used opioid in anesthesia, but it has a longer duration of action compared to remifentanil, which may not align well with the goal of rapid recovery in day care surgery.
  • • Option B
  • • opioid
  • • longer duration of action
  • • Option D . Oxycodone - Oxycodone is a strong opioid analgesic commonly used for postoperative pain management . However, its long duration of action and slower onset make it less suitable for day care anesthesia where rapid recovery is desired.
  • • Option D
  • • strong opioid analgesic
  • • postoperative pain management
  • • long duration of action
  • • slower onset

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Remifentanil , is an opioid with rapid onset , short duration of action , and titratability , as the opioid of choice for day care anesthesia , emphasizing its suitability for achieving effective pain control during short procedures and facilitating quick recovery and discharge .

questions.text: Which local anesthetic is commonly preferred for day care anesthesia due to its rapid onset, short duration of action, and favorable safety profile?
questions.explanation:
Ans. D. Chloroprocaine

Explanation:

  • • Explanation:
  • • Option A . Lidocaine - Lidocaine is a commonly used local anesthetic with a rapid onset and intermediate duration of action . However, chloroprocaine is preferred over lidocaine for day care anesthesia due to its even shorter duration of action.
  • • Option A
  • • local anesthetic
  • • rapid onset
  • • intermediate duration of action
  • • Option B . Bupivacaine - Bupivacaine is a long-acting local anesthetic commonly used for its prolonged duration of action . However, its longer duration makes it less suitable for day care anesthesia where shorter recovery times are desired.
  • • Option B
  • • long-acting local anesthetic
  • • prolonged duration of action
  • • Option C . Ropivacaine - Ropivacaine is an intermediate-acting local anesthetic with a duration of action longer than chloroprocaine. While it may be used for certain day care procedures, chloroprocaine is generally preferred for its shorter duration of action.
  • • Option C
  • • intermediate-acting local anesthetic

Educational Objective:

  • ➤ Educational Objective:
  • ➤ Chloroprocaine is a local anesthetic known for its rapid onset , short duration of action , and favorable safety profile , and is a commonly preferred choice for day care anesthesia , particularly for achieving effective regional anesthesia while allowing for quick recovery and discharge in outpatient settings .
